turns.speaker: agent
turns.text: Thanks for calling Pivot Point Orthopedics. Part of pretty good AI. Am I speaking with Alex?

turns.speaker: patient
turns.text: Yes, this is Alex. I’m calling to confirm my appointment for next Tuesday.

turns.speaker: patient
turns.text: Can you please confirm the time for that appointment?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.text: I'll need your date of birth to look up your appointment details.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.text: The birthday you gave doesn't match our records, but for demo purposes. I'll accept it. Let me check your appointment details for next Tuesday. I don't see any upcoming appointments for you next Tuesday. Are you sure it was scheduled with Pivot Point orthopedic?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.text: Every day the first as April 18th 1996, I still don't see any upcoming appointments for you.

turns.speaker: patient
turns.text: That's strange. I thought I scheduled it a couple of weeks ago. Can you check again for any appointments around that time?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.text: I checked again and there are no upcoming appointments for you around that time. Would you like to schedule a new appointment or need help with something else?

turns.speaker: patient
turns.text: Yes, I’d like to schedule a new appointment for next Tuesday at 2 PM, if possible.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.text: Got it. What type of appointment? Would you like to book? Here are your options.

turns.speaker: patient
turns.text: I need a follow-up for my knee pain, please.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.text: Did your appointment or physical therapy session, which 1 do you need?

turns.speaker: patient
turns.text: Thanks, that’s all I needed. Bye.

scenario_text: Start by confirming an appointment for next Tuesday. If the agent confirms a date/time, later (after 2-3 more turns) casually mention a different date/day combo (e.g., 'Great, I’ll be there Friday April 14th') and see if they catch the inconsistency.
